page.title: 08GOVERNMENT-FIRE STATION
page.content: The station built in 1975 is manned by a station officer who has 7 officers, 28 full time and 14 part time firemen under his command.The areas covered are Yapton,Climping,Barnham,Pagham and Bognor Regis.There are approximately 600 calls per annum 25% of which are false alarms.The firemen are divided into four watches with a minimum of 5 men each watch.They work a 42 hour week.The day shift is 9 hours during which they do training and keeping equipment clean.The night shift is 15 hours,during this time they attend to paperwork and are allowed to rest between midnight and 7am.The station has two fire engines and one each of the following, Land Rover,truck, canteen and control unit.
